repnme.cdata!:
China - Planning Support and Special
            Studies Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion Report (ICR) for the Planning Support and
Special Studies Project (PSSSP) in the People's Republic of China. The PSSSP was designed to assist the PRC in strengthening its development policy and planning capability; in preparing and implementing inter-sectoral and innovative technical assistance projects; and in strengthening key institutions responsible for economic and financial reform. IDA's performance was generally satisfactory. The overall performance of the State Planning Commission and the Ministry of Finance was satisfactory. The Borrower's performance improved in the course of project implementation. Notwithstanding some of the practical problems of implementation, overall project outcome is rated as satisfactory. The experience of PSSSP provides four principal lessons for effective implementation of technical assistance projects in China. The first is the need to designate a single entity with responsibility for project implementation, and to define monitoring and accountability mechanisms and reporting requirements at the outset. IDA should take the lead in this regard. Second, clear definition of sub-projects and an implementation schedule at the time of appraisal is more resource-efficient. Third, participating agencies should provide a thorough assessment of training needs and likely staff deployment early in the implementation process. Finally, both IDA and the coordinating agencies should pay greater attention to assisting sub-project implementing agencies in following IDA guidelines on procurement.

18153139.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

repnme.cdata!:
China - Planning Support and Special
            Studies Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Planning Support and Special Studies
            Project for China seeks to achieve three objectives: (a) to
            help strengthen the government's overall development
            policy and planning capability; (b) to identify, prepare
            and, as appropriate, carry out technical assistance
            activities of an intersectoral, innovative or experimental
            nature; and (c) to facilitate generally the implementation
            of the government's program of economic, financial and
            institutional reforms. To that end, the project consists of
            subprojects to achieve these objectives, for which IDA
            financing of $20.7 million is . About two thirds will be
            available for sector planning studies and about one third
            for technical assistance and training. At the
            government's request, a total of $9 million will be
            allocated at the outset for three comprehensive planning
            studies for the iron and steel, petrochemicals and electric
            power sectors. Subprojects will be identified and prepared
            under the technical assistance/special studies and training
            category, totalling $5 million for institution building.
            Given its technical assistance nature, the project is
            broadly justified by the contribution it will make to
            China's overall planning and reform process and by the
            qualitative support it will provide to the Bank's
            economic, sector, lending and technical assistance activities.
